metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1722 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in theRenderBlock::addChildIgnoringAnonymousColumnBlocks function incore/rendering/RenderBlock.cpp in Blink, as used in Google Chrome before34.0.1847.116, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service orpossibly have unspecified other impact via vectors involving addition of achild node.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1722` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-browser-l10n - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-chromedriver - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2').
